exclude.description: Provide a regular expression to exclude some files from being passed to the 'run' command.

files.description: Custom Git commit for files to be referenced in {files} template for the 'run' setting.

glob.description: Set a glob to filter files for your command.

priority.description: Set command priority from 1 to +Infinity. This option can be used to configure the order of the sequential commands. This option makes sense only when parallel: false or piped: true is set. Value 0 is considered an +Infinity, so commands with priority: 0 or without this setting will be run at the very end.

root.description: Change the CWD for the command you execute.

run.description: The command that is executed for the hook

Env.description: Specify environment variables for the command or script.

FailText.description: Text to show when the command or script fails.

commands.description: Commands to be executed for the hook.

exclude_tags.description: Tags or command names that you want to exclude.

files.description: A custom git command for files to be referenced in {files} template.

follow.description: Follow the STDOUT of the running commands and scripts.

parallel.description: Whether run commands and scripts concurrently.

piped.description: Whether run commands and scripts sequentially. Will stop execution if one of the commands/scripts fail.

scripts.description: Scripts to be executed for the hook.

Interactive.description: Whether to use interactive mode and provide a STDIN for a command or script.

Only.description: Force the command, script, or hook to execute only in certain conditions. This acts like the opposite of skip.

Skip.description: Skip all or specific commands and scripts

StageFixed.description: Only for the 'pre-commit' hooks, this automatically calls 'git add' after running the command or script.

Tags.description: Specify tags for commands and scripts, useful for excluding

assert_lefthook_installed.description: When set to true, fail (with exit status 1) if lefthook executable can't be found in $PATH, under node_modules/, as a Ruby gem, or other supported method. This makes sure git hook won't omit lefthook rules if lefthook ever was installed.

colors.description: Whether enable or disable colorful output of Lefthook.

extends.description: Specify files to extend config with.

min_version.description: Specify a minimum version for the lefthook binary.

no_tty.description: Whether hide spinner and other interactive things.

rc.description: Provide an rc file, which is actually a simple sh script

remote.description: DEPRECATED use remotes setting. Remote configs enable sharing of lefthook configuration across many projects.

config.description: An optional config path from remote's root.

git_url.description: A URL to Git repository. It will be accessed with privileges of the machine lefthook runs on.

ref.description: An optional branch or tag name.

configs.description: An optional array of config paths from remote's root.

git_url.description: A URL to Git repository. It will be accessed with privileges of the machine lefthook runs on.

ref.description: An optional branch or tag name.

skip_output.description: Manage verbosity by skipping the printing of output of some steps.

source_dir.description: Change a directory for script files. Directory for script files contains folders with git hook names which contain script files.

source_dir_local.description: Change a directory for local script files (not stored in VCS).
